section: This Agreement be deemed effective as of the Effective Date, Agreement and shall terminate on December 31, 2020, unless terminated earlier in accordance with Section 3.2.
explanation: The sentence structure is flawed, and it appears to have an error. It starts with "This Agreement be deemed effective" which is grammatically incorrect. It should be "This Agreement shall be deemed effective". Also, there is a repeat of the word "Agreement" after "Effective Date,".

section: Upon termination of this Agreement in its entirety pursuant to Section 3.1, all obligations of the Parties hereto shall terminate, except for the provisions of Section 2.2, and the entirety of Sections 4, 5 and 6, which shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.
explanation: Section 2.2 outlines the terms of payment and related matters. It seems contradictory that this section survives the termination of the agreement, as there would seemingly be no further 'services' to pay for after termination.

section: Recipient shall own all rights, title, and interest in any invention, technique, process, device, discovery, improvement, or know-how made by Provider which results from the Services.
explanation: This section grants all rights to inventions, etc., to the Recipient. However, it doesn't specify what happens if the invention is created independently by the Provider but utilizes knowledge or skills gained from providing the Services. This could lead to disputes over ownership of intellectual property.
